instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: 820 3023 battery issue
threads.message: 820 3023 dose not recognize battery, or run off of battery, board in not liquid damaged. <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and R5281are both good, nether line is shorted.

threads.title: 820 3023 battery issue
threads.message: Well, you have a problem there. Battery does not like 16v.... Neither does the rest of the stuff on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> / <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time.

threads.title: 820 3023 battery issue
threads.message: I don't know why turbo said anything an 16v, I have 8.18v of g3h...

threads.title: 820 3023 battery issue
threads.message: 8.2 means SMC not talking to the ISL. Dead SMC or dead ISL most likely.
